website_summaries.verdict: If you're going to be using your caliper a lot, this is a smart one to invest in because it's very precise and durable.
pros: Resistant to dirt, oil and water
Measures inside, outside, step and depth values
One of the best in terms of accuracy and durability
cons: This digital caliper may be too expensive if you're on a tight budget

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY!! GOT RIPPED OFF
customer_reviews.text: NOT HAPPY!!! Paid $125. For a fake pair. Took them to work after 3 days the screen is scrambled then realized they were FAKES . The deciding factor in purchasing these was that it was a " Amazon's choice". Would post zero stars but can't . REAL UPSET I MAKE MY LIVING WITH THESE INSPECTION TOOLS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are Chinese fakes.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these thinking they were authentic. The price certainly indicated they were real and I trusted Amazon. They work okay if you do not need absolute accuracy. For $10.00 they would have been acceptable. at nearly $100.00 I was cheated.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P.

customer_reviews.title: Getting hot
customer_reviews.text: Mine kept getting hot took the battery out change battery still got hot my end was messed up when he came in I don't know if they are counterfeit , but they're not the same thing my regular distributor sell, and there a lot of counterfeit out there.
customer_reviews.author: INDUSTRIAL MACHINE

customer_reviews.title: Nice Calipers, They seem to be authentic.
customer_reviews.text: I’m thinking highly of these calipers. I have them set to .0000 with the memory. I have to figure out why they stay on. I have to figure out which setting will turn them off after a 5 minute sit time. March 1st, Won’t hold zero, will not automatically turn on or off. Definitely a fake. I got screwed.
customer_reviews.author: Reloader57

customer_reviews.title: The calipers are a poor knock off the real thing
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE STAY AWAY FAKE! The calipers are a poor knock off the real thing. Buttons cant be pushed, number scaling choppy, sliding actuation feels sticky and heavy, plastic cover poorly molded. I bought these to replace a set for work where we have 4 pairs of real Mitutoyo calipers so i can easily spot the difference. I would really like to get my money refunded, just bought 100 dollars worth of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Ilya M Tsvetov

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't repeat and is inaccurate...  possible fake
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my old Mitutoyo calipers it looks the same but the feel is off. It's sloppy and gives inaccurate measurements. I'm constantly having to zero it off and 5 minutes later it will be off by 0.0120". I'm about 90% sure that it's counterfeit junk. The lock screw at the top is extremely sloppy as well... I won't be buying anymore Mitutoyo products from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold zero
customer_reviews.text: Will not hold zero. Jumps around constantly. Did the absolute setting per instructions and it never holds. At the price of this tool I was expecting far better quality.
customer_reviews.author: R. Parr

customer_reviews.title: Fake product!!
customer_reviews.text: I did not like this product, it’s such a poor quality. It does not work properly and the display unreadable. It’s such a waste of money. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: demiA

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these and received them from China, they are counterfeit. They are not real Mitutoyo calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Antonino B Cifaldi

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Mitutoyo. A super reliable and accurate tool.
customer_reviews.text: My older Starrett digital caliper quit on me. I was surprised that Starrett said they could no longer supply parts for it. 🙄 I have several other Mitutoyo electronic and manual measuring tools. Top notch quality and accuracy. Always reliable. I suggest that you get a “Sold and shipped by Amazon” tool. There are so many counterfeit Mitutoyo calipers on Amazon and eBay. If the price seems cheap, then it’s fake and +Hecho in China+. You’re not getting a genuine Mitutoyo digital caliper for $40, unless it was stolen. 👈 This one was around $100, as I recall. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Motorcycle Fanatic

customer_reviews.title: Authentic.
customer_reviews.text: Buy from seller: Travers Tool Co., Inc This one from this seller Travers Tool Co. Inc. is the real deal. I bought the traced one from them and got the real thing. I confirmed it with the company Mitutoyo. It’s Authentic! 5.0 A+ I really wanted a authentic one, there are so many people saying there are so many fake ones out there, counterfeits from CHINA. Just watch multiple videos on YouTube, the Battery cover and paperwork is the key difference.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product and worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it directly from Amazon. An excellent product and worth the money. Update on 11/7/18! I just noticed this certificate in the box and since it mentions "China", it occurred to me that the product I received, might be an imitation. I sent an email, along with many photos to Mitutoyo, requesting authentication. Here is the response I received, "Everything appears legitimate. I just checked a new box and we do, now, include a RoHS cert for China."
customer_reviews.author: Pearl Girl

customer_reviews.title: REPLACEMENT UNIT APPEARS TO BE REAL THING
customer_reviews.text: Believe the unit is counterfeit based on previous reviews. Specifically, the fourth digit in the inch mode is half size (should be same size as other three digits — see provided instruction sheet) and the serial number on the certificate (A18141471) does not match the serial number on the caliper (07414798). Thanks to the prior reviewers for drawing attention to the possibility of counterfeit units and ways to detect them. Returned initial unit. The replacement unit has arrived and it does not exhibit the questionable characteristics identified above. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: The excellent build quality of the Mitutoyo is far superior
customer_reviews.text: I find this device to be much more accurate and easier to use and read than a previous dial model I purchased. The previous device was a difference name brand, which I found to be of inferior quality. The excellent build quality of the Mitutoyo is far superior, and the digital readout is much easier to interpret. The reading are consistent, which is feel is attributed to the excellent build quality, with the tighter tolerances and no "slop" in the fit of the moving parts. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Consistent reading, unlike cheap HF ones
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy comes at a cost, and for years I could not justify that cost for what I used calipers for. However after doing more things that needed a more accurate reading, and getting frustrated by inconsistent readings with my cheap calipers, I splurged. I really like them, but I don’t understand why the in/mm button is recessed and the origin button sticks way out. It’s really hard to press the in/mm button. To me it seems like that should be opposite. I change between inch and mm often, yet I only used Origin button once. Thus the reason for docking it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Sandman

customer_reviews.title: Don't cheap out if you value accuracy.
customer_reviews.text: If you are trying to do anything other than get a best guess at thickness, diameter, or length of a precision part, don't cheap out and buy the $20 calipers you see. It's tempting, especially as some of them look like direct clones, but I cannot be happier with my Mitutoyo set. I had a cheap set of calipers before and had been getting some very suspect measurements on parts that I really needed to be accurate, so I sucked it up and paid out the money for my Mit, and it has already paid off, even after one day of usage. I am very confident that I am not using super worn parts on safety systems now.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Allen Hill

customer_reviews.title: The official Amazon listing is legit. Don't buy from 3rd parties!
customer_reviews.text: Note: The official Amazon listing is the real deal! Make sure when purchasing that it ships and is sold by Amazon themselves and not one of the third party sellers. Just got mine today and they absolutely live up to the Mitutoyo name. An incredibly beautiful and accurate set of calipers for someone who needs a serious tool on their workbench. Used to use these in College, but only owned a crappy $30 hardware store branded set. Worth the investment for the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: J. Desport III

customer_reviews.title: Precise, reliable, good brand
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned around five or six Mitutoyo calipers for product design where tenths of millimeters can be important. If you need precision down to the hundredth, I think these can do it but you may want to consider their higher grade calipers. I’ve never had to replace these from breaking them; I’ve lost a few or had people take them at work probably on accident. I like this version over their plastic blue ones because it has a metal turn knob to get really precise control of a measurement which you can lock it at.
customer_reviews.author: dc

customer_reviews.title: My 1,2,3 blocks agree
customer_reviews.text: This is an accurate caliper. My only quibble is that I would like imperial measurements as an option instead of only mm or tenths, but I can look it up on a table, so it isn't that big of a deal. Adjusts smoothly, easy to read. The battery compartment seems like it might be a little exposed and the cap pop off too easily, so handle with care, not like a wrench that can be tossed around. Also, there is a warning about the battery leaking if left unused for too long (months). That's a little alarming.
customer_reviews.author: Brian J. Mcmahon

customer_reviews.title: My printer and some parts I measure are closer to 7 and would have been useful at times
customer_reviews.text: Very precise all around. Sharp cut edges, smooth continuous movement. The readout never gets lost, even though it has a quick reminder zero function. It's a very solid tool. My only regret is perhaps not getting an 8" model instead ... Though so far it has been sufficient for most everything I need it for ... My printer and some parts I measure are closer to 7 and would have been useful at times.
customer_reviews.author: DirtyRob

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Caliper
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this caliper as I wanted a quality caliper capable of taking precise and accurate readings. The caliper has worked well and very easy to use. The only thing I don't care for is the lack of quality of the caliper case, specifically the hinge of the case lid Not sure how long it will hold up and plan to replace the case with a more durable case if I can find one. Otherwise, I am very pleased with the quality and build of the caliper. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: RonT

customer_reviews.title: The Real McCoy
customer_reviews.text: Just received mine from this vendor. Shipped from Amazon with one-day delivery in my area. Matches all of the characteristics of authenticity given in other reviews here. Made in Japan. Great fit & finish, easy to use and read, instructions in 11 languages plus quick start instructions (insert battery, push origin button for a few seconds). Very smooth action. Yes they are a bit pricey, but I have $50 worth of junky calipers this is replacing. Buy quality the first time and live happily ever after.
customer_reviews.author: engineer & cook

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Mitutoyo! Top quality calipers!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve finally made it in the world... well sort of. I’ve at least stepped out of the world of cheap chinesium vernier calipers (after going through three of them) to high quality, real deal Mitutoyo. These are superb in every aspect - from the fit and finish to accuracy (checked against gauge blocks). I bought these from MSI-Viking and know that they’re authentic since MSI are authorized distributors of Mitutoyo products. The old adage of “buy once, cry once” definitely holds true with precision measuring instruments.
customer_reviews.author: I C K

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several relatively inexpensive Chinese digital calipers, but none of them give consistent, reliable measurements. With the Mitutoyo, you definetely get what you pay for. Although cheaper chinese calipers often have auto shut off and a fraction mode (the Mitutoyo doesn't) these features are no substitute for repeatability and ease of use. The smoother, more controllable thumb wheel movement with better tactile feedback, is why the Mitutoyo excels with its measurements.
customer_reviews.author: wtwieder

customer_reviews.title: Great, Accurate Calipers
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is an updated version of the one I've been using for 20 years, but there isn't much to tell them apart. That's good -- why mess with success? I don't use the data output features, other than the readout on the display, so I can't comment on those. The caliper calibrated perfectly to 0.06 and 1.00 Mitutoyo calibration blocks, as expected (and, so did the 20-year old caliper!). They're not the least expensive caliper out there, but they'll provide an accurate, reliable measurement when it's needed the most.
customer_reviews.author: Karen N

customer_reviews.title: Great digi calipers
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to review some YouTube videos of this product to see the differences between the real deal and the counterfeits. After seeing other reviews, I wanted to make sure I get what I paid for. The calipers I received are legit and worked well for setting up my Ameriglo Spartan Operator night sights for my Glock 21. These calipers are easy to setup and use. I highly recommend for those who need to make precise measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R

customer_reviews.title: Fine print
customer_reviews.text: To big of a + or - for me. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Okis

customer_reviews.title: Good, Acurrate  Calipers at a good price !
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice Caliper. They are well made, easy to read and durable. There are more expensive Calipers out there and as some us know, Price doesn't always reflect quality. Price for measuring instruments is usually conducive to Accuracy and Traceability of the instrument as well. I have used this model caliper in the aircraft and medical device industries and this model caliper has always done its job under normal circumstances. There really is no other Caliper I would want at this point. And oohhh ........ it has always come in a nice protective case over the years !
customer_reviews.author: Robert J McConnell

customer_reviews.title: The Real Thing
customer_reviews.text: After reading the mixed reviews of real versus fake, I decided to go ahead and take my chances. After all, if it was fake, it would be easy to return, unlike the ones at the auction site. Got mine today. Looking it over, and comparing to all of the information I could find online, it appears to be the real thing. Action is tight with no slop. Checked it out on some feeler gauges. Within 0.0005". Close enough if you're not designing a spaceship!
customer_reviews.author: James Quashnock

customer_reviews.title: I finally caved and spent the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: I finally caved and spent the $$$$ on a good caliper. I've been "using" a Kobalt caliper for a few years and it works really well but IT NEVER SHUTS OFF! What this means is most every time you want to use it, the battery is dead. Not so with this caliper. From my inspection, this looks like a genuine Mitutoyo but even if it's not, it's MILES ahead of the Kobalt and other cheaper digital calipers.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: I have feeler gauges and it gave me the perfect measurement in all of them
customer_reviews.text: Smooth, well made and accurate. I have feeler gauges and it gave me the perfect measurement in all of them, ranging from .0015" to .025". I had used the inexpensive calipers for years, but now that I have this Mitutoyo I couldn't go back to the cheap ones. Repeatable results over and over again. With the other ones, it was different readings and I just got tired of this. BUY ONE, you won't look back!
customer_reviews.author: rickyny

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal from Amazon.com LLC, not a counterfeit!
customer_reviews.text: After hearing this is one of the most counterfeited calipers on the market. I carefully inspected it upon arrival, using a YouTube video and an Amazon review (How to tell if your calipers are genuine / Buy from Amazon.com LLC) with photos for reference. Everything matches up perfectly, serial number, correct battery, calibration holes, etc. with the real thing. It works flawlessly, making my old Harbor Freight caliper look like junk. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: ANCIENTMURRELET

customer_reviews.title: Had to return lesser calipers. This one is a keeper
customer_reviews.text: Love the precise construction and quality of this measuring tool. I get consistency and accuracy which is essential for the reloading hobby. A bit pricey but you get superior performance in return. I have no experience with dial calipers so I can't compare to those but I've used several other brands of digital ones and they don't hold a candle to the precision and build quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: JNFoo

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and repeatable measurements
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat genuine Mitutoyo for quality measuring tools. I used the handy guide posted in the amazon review section to verify I had a genuine Mitutoyo product (sold by Amazon). You can feel the precision when you use this tool. The movement is precise and has a solid feel. These are well worth the investment both in cost and peace of mind that your measurements are accurate.
customer_reviews.author: JamesTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Very fine quality
customer_reviews.text: Ooooh. Aaaah. It's a silky smooth little beauty. It's actually way more precise than I often need. I have another caliper I use more often that is only accurate to .05mm. This one is the high judge and the final arbiter. It's also remarkably consistent down to its last digit when repeatedly measuring the same point. I'm sure there are more precise micrometers, but I don't know if there is a more precise caliper of this style.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Great Super Accurate Caliper
customer_reviews.text: This caliper is so good and accurate I never thought about such a thing existed. I’ve used some cheap analog ones and I had a “OK” digital one but had some inaccuracies with the measurement when using it to check against the mechanical team. (Most embarrassing moment). Then I came across this for a deal and wanted to get it as the accuracy is beyond any that I’ve used. Fast forward to my current job and was I surprised that they use the exact model and brand!!! This has been the best purchase to verify critical thickness of materials and boards!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: The Real Deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal! As soon as you take it out of the package and hold it you know you have quality in your hands and a very well make tool. All the paperwork was correct and noway this is made in China, definitely a high quality Mitutoyo caliper. I also have Mitutoyo calibrating blocks and the accuracy of this was dead on at all measuring points. If you depend on accuracy don't buy the other crap out there, save the money for this one,
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I use a digital caliper daily. I wear one of these out over a years time and still have no complaints. Much smoother operation and repeatability than the cheaper ones. I use 2 batteries per year even when its left on most of the time. The only small Issue I have with the caliper is the MM /inch button is hard for me to use. I have large fingers and its a small button that doesnt protude as far as the other buttons. Probably to keep it from switching on you if you bump it handling the caliper.
customer_reviews.author: mredburn

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them.
customer_reviews.text: I had been contemplating which calipers to buy for a while now. I settled on these and purchased directly from Amazon (not a 3rd party seller). Works excellent fit and finish is superb. Is dead on accurate with feeler gauges. No issues holding zero at all. Worth the money. BUY ONCE CRY ONCE. From everything I can find these appear to be genuine.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: How is this thing so good for the price?!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This thing is only ~$100?! This thing is super precise. Exactly as they advertise it. Feels heavy. “Sharp” machined edges. Smooth action. Easy to read. I strongly recommend this. Pictured I used the check gauges for my micrometer across a wide range and it stayed consistent back and forth and back and forth. Super sweet...
customer_reviews.author: Station2Station

customer_reviews.title: Probably good advice from other reviewers not to buy this tool ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow I actually received the genuine article. Probably good advice from other reviewers not to buy this tool from sellers outside of amazon. I resisted digital calipers for a long time and sticking with my verniers but it sure makes work faster being able to read a decimal display. I will continue to use verniers for less precision work or dirtier environments.
customer_reviews.author: Ptah

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and to set up. I bought this model because it's what we use at work. The box interior is sturdy molded plastic and not the foam stuff that falls apart after a few years. I am very happy with this purchase. Great tool for the workbench, shop, or studio but probably not good enough for a laboratory environment. Well constructed and sturdy. I have never felt like I was going to break one of these by accident.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schantz

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of calipers
customer_reviews.text: Use these all day everyday at work. We have very tight tolerances to deal with so I need something reliable and accurate and these fit the bill. Would recommend, my only gripe is there is no auto off. I have been know to accidentally leave them on over night, or over a weekend. Not a huge deal especially since that battery seems to last quite some time, but would be nice to have .
customer_reviews.author: Hartford Whalers 20

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for precision measuring....
customer_reviews.text: I had to order this model after being disappointed in a Made in China model that was about one third the price. I wasn't looking for a bargain.... just something that was accurate and well made. This Mitutoyo is made in Japan, not China. It was made well and there was no wobble in the jaws. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Fosselman

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from Amazon as seller, it is a genuine Mitutoyo. Everything you have read about Mitutoyo is true, a very nicely made caliper. What drove me to buy the Mitutoyo was replacing the cheap ones every couple years. The problem when the cheap ones start to go you are not sure if you are getting a good measurement. Time will tell if the Mitutoyo was the right thing to do, I expect so.
customer_reviews.author: Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to accompany my new 3d printer and figured, if I am going to pay over $500 for a 3d printer....I can't skimp on my measuring tool. This thing feels like a hunting tool, it feels great in the hands. Nice and heavy, smooth metal and smooth movements for measurement. I didn't realize how sharp this would be haha it scares me a bit, but love this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie N

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get a genuine Mitutoyo it is worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: The genuine Mitutoyo is as good as any other first class caliper being sold anywhere. The genuine Mitutoyo as sold by Amazon is fairly easily distinguished from the many fakes sometimes sold by others. I don't know why fakes are even allowed to be sold on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ancient DIY'er

customer_reviews.title: These are a good choice for someone who wants a quality digital instrument ...
customer_reviews.text: In a word I would describe these calipers as "NICE" . Silky smooth slide and an overall feel that speaks of Quality. These are a good choice for someone who wants a quality digital instrument at a not so bad price.These Japanese made calipers are definitely several cuts above the cheap China ones that are IMO not worth a darn and are a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: wmdshooter

customer_reviews.title: Meets expectations, looks authentic.
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. Looks authentic to me based on comparisons with Crafty's photos. Will reserve my 5-star rating for later once I've had a chance to use it for full accuracy, but given its basic function I'm not concerned. Solid feel, tight response to the thumb roller. I've added a few additional photos since mine is a calibrated version.
customer_reviews.author: eagle364

customer_reviews.title: Is it too much to ask?
customer_reviews.text: For how much it cost, you would think it would have the ability to turn itself off when not in use. It's a choice of wearing out the on/off button or having to replace the battery more often. Tried going cheaper, but the accuracy isn't there. Do I really need to spend more than what this cost to get one that turns itself off? Pretty lame Mitutoyo.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Foster

customer_reviews.title: Great option, high quality, still a little variablity
customer_reviews.text: Great option, high quality, still a little variability. I feel like I have to zero somewhat often to be confident of readings. For the price, I expect more reliable readings. I have gotten seemingly equal performance from lower priced products from other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Smooth Operation
customer_reviews.text: Like the feel, the silky smoothness of motion this caliper provides. Repeats measurements very well. I tested against Jo Blocks and mic standards - measures perfectly each time. As good as any Starrett or B&S Calipers I have ever owned before - no buyers remorse for me.
customer_reviews.author: GrandPapa Stephen

customer_reviews.title: A sheer joy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I used to think I was fine with my old-school calipers - that an accurate digital readout was a luxury I didn't need. I was wrong. Seriously...the accuracy of these is mind-blowing. They don't drift...that is their claim...and they are correct. Each reading is as accurate as the first. These make my job so much easier...can't believe I held off this long on springing for them. Less eye strain - less brain strain...they are a bargain at $90 USD.
customer_reviews.author: DanMan

customer_reviews.title: Oh so smooth
customer_reviews.text: My old Mitutoyo dial calipers are getting a little worn, so I decided to finally go digital. Should have done it long ago. Very smooth with nice big numbers for my tired old eyes. I've never been disappointed with Mitutoyo.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Great calipers, accurate with long battery life.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best calipers I've ever used. Compared to cheaper brands you almost never need to change the battery and the measurements are extremely consistent. I am in charge of calibrations for a manufacturing group, and I've never had a Mitutoyo go out of spec in 10 years. Only since this seems to be a point of discussion on the reviews here, the unit I received was definitely genuine
customer_reviews.author: Jared G

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Mitutoyo 500 series caliper
customer_reviews.text: I bought the caliper with the calibration certificate so I can use it for my work and the caliper I received was genuine. My workplace accepted the calibration certificate and they also tested it for use in the field. I cant wait to use it daily!
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: Been a machinist all my life and this is definitely not the item described. Very poor quality. In my opinion it has to be a knock off. It’s not smooth and it’s not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Apparel Addikt

customer_reviews.title: The real Deal!
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal and very nice set of calipers. I am a shop supervisor with 40+ years in the trade and have used many sets over the years and these with the new features the last few years stand out as an excellent bargain!
customer_reviews.author: KPat

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's made in China. Wouldn't have bought it, if I had known that.
customer_reviews.author: ard322

customer_reviews.title: Missing Authenticity Certificate from Mitutoyo!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased these, paid the extra few dollars for the Certificate of Traceability to NIST....alas, this is where it lost 1 Star. I got that certificate, BUT I did NOT get the Certificate of Authenticity from Mitutoyo! I am hoping/assuming that it was accidentally lost while performing the certification of calibration, as everything else appears to be correct.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas S

customer_reviews.title: Not like the ones made years ago.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent, though the slide movement feels a bit scratchy like I would expect from Chinese calipers. Mitutoyo quality is slipping. This is really borderline 3-star for the prices they charge.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Young

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Well Made Caliper
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews, I was concerned about receiving a fake unit. The received unit is genuine and very well made. When I compared it against a reference block and thickness gages, it was spot on. Could not be happier - especially at the reduced price.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: You really do get what you pay for with this, they aren't cheap but they are the standard. Watch out for counterfeits but the ones I received were real. Very well designed and manufactured, no rough edges and mating surfaces are very flat and parallel. Even the case sturdy and exudes precision.
customer_reviews.author: J J.

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Mitutoyo
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a Mitutoyo for a long time and finally got around to it. Mine arrived well packaged and it is a genuine Mitutoyo product. As other reviews have stated, vast numbers of these calipers are counterfeited in China. The real thing is so well finished and precise; it is a pleasure to use--and just to hold.
customer_reviews.author: W. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely precise
customer_reviews.text: I tested this with a Mitutoyo 0.101 guage block and it was absolutely perfect. If you are an ammo reloader or doing anything else that requires precision, this is a great caliper for that task. I'm absolutely thrilled with this fine instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Jasef

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Best
customer_reviews.text: In a misguided attempt to save a buck, I've tried a really cheap one and an I-Guage. The cheap one isn't even a good paper weight. The I-Guage is much better, but not in the same league as the Mit. More consistent, more accurate, holds zero all the time, and offfers better support. Don't futz around. Just buy the Miotutoyo.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: Seems good to have caliper stay zeroed. Battery doesn't go dead while in tool box like the one from H.F. I needed a constant supply of batteries on hand because I forget to remove the battery.
customer_reviews.author: gary h.

customer_reviews.title: I bought these mitutoyo's because i became very disappointed with my starrett calipers and i'm satisfied with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these mitutoyo's because i became very disappointed with my starrett calipers and i'm satisfied with the quality so far.The only thing i miss from my starretts is they would turn on with any movement of the jaws and no need to zero them out. Starrett really lost a lot of quality by manufacturing in china.If i want poor quality i'll buy them at Harbor Freight.Their prices do not reflect lower labor costs but the product quality does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customerbryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Calipers
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of cheap calipers that were off .001 or more, and bought these. They measure perfectly on my pin gauges and gauge blocks, very happy with them. They are very smooth and nice to use as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: THESE ARE GENUINE MITUTOYO CALIPERS for CHEAP!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 6" while they were on sale via Amazon for 103.95. I was a bit hesitant given that the price is more than 50 dollars cheaper than elsewhere, but they arrived and are indeed genuine. Follow the ConsumerGuys detailed steps to checking their authenticity. What a bargain! I was a bit concerned when inserting the battery and the unit just continually blinked. I then realized that instructions where right and front of me and when installing a new battery you need to hold the origin button for one second.
customer_reviews.author: deep

customer_reviews.title: Im amazed how long the battery lasts if I leave it ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is very very well made. Im amazed how long the battery lasts if I leave it on. Ive had this almost two years now and I still havent needed to replace it. I use this to measure rifle cases and in large volume. I had to recal maybe once but thats unrealistic. I guess I am just not used to this level of quality anymore. Thanks Mitutoyo!!! I wish you could build me a refrigerator!
customer_reviews.author: Midwestdude

customer_reviews.title: Great caliper always returns to zero
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic caliper. Feels great in the hand. Makes you want to go out and measure things! Can't believe we can buy this kind of tech at a such a reasonable price. Have had it for a couple of years and find I use it around once a month. Super happy with this caliper.
customer_reviews.author: SkyBird

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality and Value
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality of Mitutoyo is legendary. I have used their measuring tools for many years and this one is no different. Great Quality, and Value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Redding

customer_reviews.title: I have been watching this for ever and finally stole one for $116
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal not some knock off junk. You get what you pay for and this was a deal offered by Amazon so I bought one along with a micrometer both for $250 what a steal saved over $100
customer_reviews.author: Dino / Sassy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best calipers available
customer_reviews.text: Extremely accurate, well made, NIST calibrated, what more can a person ask for. I would say they are nicer than currently produced starretts. I use them every day, so far they are holding up great.
customer_reviews.author: Gibby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality - So Smooth
customer_reviews.text: These are the nicest calipers I've personally used. Miles above the cheap Harbor Freight variety. They are extremely smooth (no binding) and they return to zero every time. They're also a good size for general use. I only wish the case had a soft lining of some kind to protect them better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if I would call this the most accurate instrument I have, but for a general use shop tool, it seems to be working well enough and no one has destroyed it yet. Overall happy with the durability and function.
customer_reviews.author: Muscle Car Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Xmas in June!! Got home from work and ...
customer_reviews.text: Xmas in June!! Got home from work and my new calipers were waiting for me!! Used the review to check and make sure I received a real Mitutoyo( I already have cheap chinese pair of calipers). I feel I have received a genuine Mitutoyo. Confirmed the paperwork with review! anyways, the feeling in hand is substancial, a little heavier than my Jim-Dandy chinese ones. After zeroing out, slid it several times fast and slow to see if it would return to zero,.... every time, Can't wait to do some reloading now,.... BY
customer_reviews.author: michael Liljegren

customer_reviews.title: Reliability and Repeatability
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, you can buy a $10 pair at Harbor Freight and I suppose if you're measuring lumber, they are "close enough." I require reliability and repeatability for critical tolerances two places past the decimal, and Mitutoyo instruments have never disappointed. This caliper includes a serialized and signed Certificate of Accuracy if you have traceability requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Slocum

customer_reviews.title: Expensive.....but worth it
customer_reviews.text: You know what you get with a cheap set of calipers? Crap results.....that's what. They FLEX! This set is much better, the accuracy is exactly what I needed and I'm completely happy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M Testa

customer_reviews.title: Mitutoya - can't go wrong
customer_reviews.text: Great calipers. The slides are a little variable for how much friction they have (yes, even after adjusting the set screw). All-in-all, these are quality calipers. A must-have for engineers.
customer_reviews.author: The Magnus Effect

customer_reviews.title: Accurate as I'll ever need and keeps it's bloody ZERO !!
customer_reviews.text: This is the finest caliper I've owned and it keeps it's zero perfectly. it's easy to read and very VERY precise. The Case is durable and protects your investment VERY well. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Mark B. Ostrom

customer_reviews.title: Confirmed Authenticity
customer_reviews.text: The world standard calipers. Zeroes every time. Remember you only need to bottom out the lock screw with one finger, nothing more. The Toyota of measuring instruments. Affordable durable and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Noname Norelation

customer_reviews.title: They may have been authentic but they had an issue
customer_reviews.text: All of the indicators said I got an authentic Mitutoyo caliper, but they would not return to zero after being turned off and the next time I turned them on it read .0010 or .0005 and I would have to re-zero every time. I talked to tech support at Mitutoyo and he said theirs are supposed to hold zero. I sent it back to Amazon and ordered one from one of Mitutoyo's authorized distributors. I paid a little bit more, but peace of mind that I get a quality tool is worth a few dollars more.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Davis-Landry

customer_reviews.title: The best calipers!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Mitutoyo 500-196-30 calipers! I previously had the cheep Chinese $20 knockoffs, which to be honest gave me about $5 of reliability. These Mitutoyo's on the other hand are perfect, perfect fit and finish. Really easy to use, battery lasts forever. The case is a perfect fit for the calipers and a spare battery and its rugged. I would highly recommend them to anyone in need of calipers. It’s a one time purchase and could last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: the Real Deal - just try the repeat readings - ...
customer_reviews.text: the Real Deal - just try the repeat readings - it holds zero - slide the caliper open and with other makes - you'll be off by .003 to .007 or so - this instrument will take a sec or so to settle down to .0000 almost every time you open and close the jaws - WHAT'S THAT MEAN - ok - if you're Casting Bullets Sizing Case Necks - Sizing Pistons Cylinders this kind of Accuracy and Repeat Reading Accuracy is Critical.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Best calipers
customer_reviews.text: Mitutoyo is just the best. Their calipers are the best for the price there is no problem with accuracy. I also recommend their self healing cutting mats but that’s just me.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This replaced your average run of the mill caliper from the big box stores. It's Mitutoyo...what else is there to say? I should have bought this eons ago. I'd suggest this to anyone. Repeatable, accurate, reliable, easy to use. Everything I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have messed around and bought bargain calipers but they just aren't worth it as they invariably let you down. Mitutoyo builds quality and a very high standard of accuracy and durability. It shows.
customer_reviews.author: audinut

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for precision measures High quality calipers Receive genuine mitutoyo product Excellent and come with certificate Best caliper I own to date
customer_reviews.author: Dariusz Orzolek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, amazing precision
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you buy it from Amazon and you will not get a fake. I received a real set and they work amazingly. Excellent precision and accuracy, great repeatability, all the features you would need. Nothing bad to say about the product.
customer_reviews.author: Brennan Perry

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Mitutoyo digimatic caliper, I went thru the posted check list and everything passed that I have the real deal and not a fake. The caliper is well made and extremely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Willard F. Remmel

customer_reviews.title: Accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my cheapie caliper. Checked with a gauge block and right on the money. Watch out for "bargain" Mitutoyo marked calipers. There are a bunch of knock-offs out there.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Want Value, Accuracy Quality? Buy!
customer_reviews.text: If you ask me everything thing should be made in Japan. The Japanese designs and QC is second to none. You get what you pay for. I want to thank American corporations, unions and politicians for their guidance.
customer_reviews.author: Fjon

customer_reviews.title: Real Mitutoya 500-196-30
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical after seeing so many mixed reviews with this product! Fake or real? I work in a factory in the Tool and Die shop and needed a pair of calipers that were reliable and held up. I was told between a Mitutoya and a Starrett but I decided going with Mitutoya. It came with the SR-44 battery NOT installed. The signature on the paperwork looked real instead of scanned. Every lines up where it should! I’m very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Ami Swaw

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price and as far as I can work out it's definitely genuine and not a fake Mitutoyo. They sell for 3 times the price locally so couldn't be happier. Big upgrade over my previous generic caliper.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hall

customer_reviews.title: Authentic caliper
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying this because of all the counterfits for sale. I was relieved to get the real deal. Excellent digital caliper.
customer_reviews.author: Overthinker

customer_reviews.title: so far pretty good
customer_reviews.text: feels pretty reliable, I just wish it has an auto power off feature because I found myself leaving it on for hours, i can see the battery running out very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Angel A. Perez

customer_reviews.title: great for quick measurements
customer_reviews.text: my only complaint is the plastic is susceptible to Acetone. I accidentally splashed a small amount on one of my calipers and it managed to glue the battery compartment door shut permanently
customer_reviews.author: pseudonym

customer_reviews.title: It is a Mitutoyo. No surprises.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. I still prefer the precision of the old (no screen) version, but this caliper is great for almost all jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro

product_meta.title: Mitutoyo 500-196-30 Advanced Onsite Sensor (AOS) Absolute Scale Digital Caliper, 0 to 6"/0 to 150mm Measuring Range, 0.0005"/0.01mm Resolution, LCD
product_meta.description:
Style:Standard

The Mitutoyo 500-196-30 digital caliper has a 0 to 6" (0 to 150mm) measuring range with 0.0005" (0.01mm) increments for precision and an advanced onsite sensor (AOS) electromagnetic inductive sensor for resistance to dirt, oil, and water. Its digital readout LCD shows inch or metric units for versatility, and allows either absolute or incremental measurement readings. The electronic caliper measures inside, outside, depth, and step values for versatility and includes a protective case and SR44 silver oxide battery.

Digital calipers are measuring instruments commonly used for inspection in manufacturing to provide the precise measurements of an object. A pair of jaws attached to a long beam with a marked scale is used to take inside, outside, and step measurements. An additional depth probe slides along the beam to take depth measurements. One jaw is fixed to the end of the scale, while the other jaw slides along it with gearless precision to take measurements. The reading is electronically generated and displayed on a digital, high-resolution screen as a single value. Digital calipers can take differential measurements, which are used to determine the difference in measurements between two objects, by zeroing the display at any point along the scale. Some digital calipers can switch between standard and metric units, and some can output readings to a computer or printer for recording measurements. Compared to dial calipers, digital calipers provide measurements that are faster, easier, and more error-free, but they are more fragile mechanically and electronically, and do not resist coolant well. Vernier calipers are more durable than digital calipers because they do not have internal moving parts, but they can be more difficult to read. Digital calipers are commonly used in fields such as metalworking, mechanical engineering, machining, carpentry, and medicine.

Mitutoyo manufactures precision measuring tools, metrology equipment, and related systems. The company, founded in Tokyo in 1934, formed Mitutoyo America Corporation in 1963 with headquarters in Aurora, IL.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
 * Electronic caliper
 * SR44 battery
 * Protective case
feature_bullets: Measures 0 to 6" (0 to 150mm) in 0.0005" (0.01mm) increments for precision use
Digital readout LCD shows inch or metric units for versatility when measuring
Advanced onsite sensor (AOS) electromagnetic inductive sensor for resistance to dirt, oil, and water
Measures inside, outside, depth, and step values for versatility. With thumb roller. Except 500-500-10, 500-501-10,500-502-10
Includes protective case and SR44 silver oxide battery

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
